children.text: The waterproofing membrane in this area appears to be excessively thin, indicating that either the waterproofing membrane has not been properly installed, or not enough coats of material have been applied.

Although it is not possible for us to measure the exact thickness of the applied waterproofing membrane while it is installed, it should not appear thin and bare, with the substrate visible underneath.
Part 3.8.1.2 of the NCC's Building Code of Australia (BCA) - Wet Areas, states that;
‘Building elements in wet areas within a building must be waterproof or water resistant in accordance with Table 3.8.1.1; and comply with AS 3740’ .
Additionally, the builder warrants that the work will be carried out in
, which is not the case in this area.

These areas must be rectified to be fully waterproofed to protect the building elements from damage in accordance with the BCA, Australian Standards and manufacturer’s requirements, which will most likely require additional coats of waterproofing be installed.
